name: methyl 3-[bis(methylsulfanyl)methyl]-4-cyano-2-hydroxy-2,5-diphenylcyclopent-3-ene-1-carboxylate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1667
Reason: 3-phenyl-2-methyl-2,5-diphenylcyclopent-1-ene has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The basic unit we can compare to is the melting point of a basic aromatic system such as benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The additional functional groups and structural features in 3-phenyl-2-methyl-2,5-diphenylcyclopent-1-ene will affect its melting point: (1) Two phenyl groups, which could each add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, adding about +5 due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume; (3) The cyano group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C; (4) The carboxyl group introduces a hydroxyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
